name: NPR
text:
Tuesday's surge of Black progressives could prove notable for the presidential race. 

If Democrats have two key pillars of their base fired up — women and Black voters — that could be a game-changer, as President Trump’s approval continues to suffer.
https://t.co/fkWBTSCCrk

name: NPR
text:
Opinion: @nprscottsimon remembers Michael Hawley, a remarkable polymath and exceptional friend, who died this past week at 58.
 https://t.co/u4h0DQp74d

name: NPR
text:
South Korea conscripted over 30,000 soldiers between the ages of 14 to 17 for the Korean War. An estimated 3,000 died.

Some believe these child soldiers saved the nation from defeat. 

The survivors are nearing 90. And they still want proper recognition. https://t.co/ZprJyr6wd0

name: NPR
text: Unrest over racial injustice spotlights the acute need for — and the high historical barriers to — mental health treatment for Black people. https://t.co/b2tauuJR0q
